bug.author: joshuamin2014
bug.summary: 'cp949' codec error during opening hello app
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I just installed streamlit, and ran 'streamlit hello', but I got 'Script execution error' with the following message: 'cp949' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position 985: ... <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run the hello script
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
It should show the demo apps list <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
A pop up with error message in it <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.48.1 Python version: 3.6.8 Using Conda? conda 4.7.12 OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Chrome Version 77.0.3865.90 (Official Build) (64-bit)
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
Not sure if it matters, but my preferred languages (Windows setting) are in Korean, then English order.

comments.comment: I believe we recently fixed this in PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/441>#441</denchmark-link> which should be out with the next Streamlit version in a few days. So I'll close this for now. If the problem persists with 0.49.0, please reopen.
